title: Friday evening news bulletin: Boris Johnson tells Jeremy Corbyn to 'man up' and back December 12 general election
text:
Essex lorry deaths: Fears after woman sent mother dying texts

A Vietnamese woman is feared to be among the 39 migrants found dead in the back of a lorry after she texted her family saying that she was "dying because I can't breathe". Pham Thi Tra My, 26, had been attempting to get into the UK when she text her mother on Wednesday to tell her that she loved her and that she was dying. In a series of desperate texts, sent at the same time that the refrigerated trailer was making its way to Purfleet in Essex, she told her mother "love you so much" and "I am sorry". Read the heartbreaking messages, which emerged after China blamed Britain for the deaths saying it was "clear" the UK had "not fulfilled their responsibility to protect these people". Here's the latest.

Prince Harry and Meghan make first appearance since TV show

The Duke of Sussex was a surprise arrival for guests at a discussion on improving gender equality chaired by his wife, in the first public engagement of the couple since their emotional ITV documentary. The Duchess of Sussex had been meeting with youth ambassadors from One Young World at Windsor Castle this morning for a roundtable debate. On her husband's arrival, the Duchess thanked guests for "letting him crash the party" as she said a conversation about gender equality and female empowerment "can't happen without men". See pictures of the pair beaming as they met the delegates.

News digest

Video: Tens of thousands evacuated as wildfires rage

Some 50,000 people were ordered to flee their homes north of Los Angeles as a fast-moving wildfire driven by high winds erupted and raged out of control. The so-called Tick Fire near Santa Clarita, about 40 miles (65km) north of Los Angeles, broke out in the early afternoon and quickly consumed 5,000 acres, fire officials said. Watch the scenes after the fires swept the area.
